Get doc ID reads

Source: R/get_docid_reads.R
get_docid_reads.Rd

Get doc ID reads

get_docid_reads(scope, identifier, env = "production")

Arguments

scope

(character) Scope of data package
identifier

(numeric) Identifier of data package
env

(character) Repository environment. Can be: "production", "staging", or "development".

Value

(xml_document) Summary of all the successful reads (total reads and non-robot reads) for all the resources of a given scope and identifier.

See also

Other Audit Manager Services: get_audit_count(), get_audit_record(), get_audit_report(), get_packageid_reads(), get_recent_uploads()

Examples

# Get all reads
resourceReads <- get_docid_reads(scope = "knb-lter-sgs", identifier = 817)
resourceReads

#> {xml_document}
#> <resourceReads>
#> [1] <resource>\n  <resourceId>https://pasta.lternet.edu/package/metadata/eml/ ...
#> [2] <resource>\n  <resourceId>https://pasta.lternet.edu/package/eml/knb-lter- ...
#> [3] <resource>\n  <resourceId>https://pasta.lternet.edu/package/report/eml/kn ...
#> [4] <resource>\n  <resourceId>https://pasta.lternet.edu/package/data/eml/knb- ...

# Get the first resource
resource <- xml2::xml_find_first(resourceReads, ".//resource")
resource

#> {xml_node}
#> <resource>
#> [1] <resourceId>https://pasta.lternet.edu/package/metadata/eml/knb-lter-sgs/8 ...
#> [2] <resourceType>metadata</resourceType>
#> [3] <scope>knb-lter-sgs</scope>
#> [4] <identifier>817</identifier>
#> [5] <revision>17</revision>
#> [6] <totalReads>534</totalReads>
#> [7] <nonRobotReads>517</nonRobotReads>
